t: Mark 8
Feeding Four Thousand
In*p those days there was again a large crowd, and they had nothing to eat. He called the disciples and said to them,
“I*r have*r compassion*r on*r the*r crowd,*r because*r they’ve*r already*r stayed*r with*r me*r three*r days*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat.*r
If*r I*r send*r them*r home*r hungry,*r they*r will*r collapse*r on*r the*r way,*r and*r some*r of*r them*r have*r come*r a*r long*r distance.”*r
His*p disciples answered him, “Where can anyone get enough bread here in this desolate place to feed these people?”
“How*rp many*r loaves*r do*r you*r have?”*r he asked them. “Seven,”*p they said.
He commanded the crowd to sit down on the ground. Taking the seven loaves, he gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to his disciples to set before the people. So they served them to the crowd.
They also had a few small fish, and after he had blessed them, he said these were to be served as well.
They ate and were satisfied. Then they collected seven large baskets of leftover pieces.
About four thousand were there. He dismissed them.
And he immediately got into the boat with his disciples and went to the district of Dalmanutha.
The Leaven of the Pharisees and Herod
The*p Pharisees came and began to argue with him, demanding of him a sign from heaven to test him.
Sighing deeply in his spirit, he said, “Why*r does*r this*r generation*r demand*r a*r sign?*r Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r no*r sign*r will*r be*r given*r to*r this*r generation.”*r
Then he left them, got back into the boat, and went to the other side.
The*p disciples had forgotten to take bread and had only one loaf with them in the boat.
Then he gave them strict orders: “Watch*r out!*r Beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r the*r leaven*r of*r Herod.”*r
They were discussing among themselves that they did not have any bread.
Aware of this, he said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r discussing*r the*r fact*r you*r have*r no*r bread?*r Don’t*r you*r understand*r or*r comprehend?*r Do*r you*r have*r hardened*r hearts?*r
Do*ir you*ir have*ir eyes*ir and*ir not*ir see;*ir do*ir you*ir have*ir ears*ir and*ir not*ir hear?*ir And*r do*r you*r not*r remember?*r
When*r I*r broke*r the*r five*r loaves*r for*r the*r five*r thousand,*r how*r many*r baskets*r full*r of*r leftovers*r did*r you*r collect?”*r “Twelve,”*p they told him.
“When*rp I*r broke*r the*r seven*r loaves*r for*r the*r four*r thousand,*r how*r many*r baskets*r full*r of*r pieces*r did*r you*r collect?”*r “Seven,”*p they said.
And*p he said to them, “Don’t*r you*r understand*r yet?”*r
Healing a Blind Man
They*p came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him and begged him to touch him.
He took the blind man by the hand and brought him out of the village. Spitting on his eyes and laying his hands on him, he asked him, “Do*r you*r see*r anything?”*r
He*p looked up and said, “I see people - they look like trees walking.”
Again*p Jesus placed his hands on the man’s eyes. The man looked intently and his sight was restored and he saw everything clearly.
Then he sent him home, saying, “Don’t*r even*r go*r into*r the*r village.”*r
Peter’s Confession of the Messiah
Jesus*p went out with his disciples to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. And on the road he asked his disciples, “Who*r do*r people*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
They*p answered him, “John the Baptist; others, Elijah; still others, one of the prophets.”
“But*rp you,”*r he asked them, “who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r Peter*p answered him, “You are the Messiah.”
And he strictly warned them to tell no one about him.
His Death and Resurrection Predicted
Then*p he began to teach them that it was necessary for the Son of Man to suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, be killed, and rise after three days.
He spoke openly about this. Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
But turning around and looking at his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get*r behind*r me,*r Satan!*r You*r are*r not*r thinking*r about*r God’s*r concerns*r but*r human*r concerns.”*r
Take Up Your Cross
Calling*p the crowd along with his disciples, he said to them, “If*r anyone*r wants*r to*r follow*r after*r me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r take*r up*r his*r cross,*r and*r follow*r me.*r
For*r whoever*r wants*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r because*r of*r me*r and*r the*r gospel*r will*r save*r it.*r
For*r what*r does*r it*r benefit*r someone*r to*r gain*r the*r whole*r world*r and*r yet*r lose*r his*r life?*r
What*r can*r anyone*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r life?*r

For*r whoever*r is*r ashamed*r of*r me*r and*r my*r words*r in*r this*r adulterous*r and*r sinful*r generation,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r also*r be*r ashamed*r of*r him*r when*r he*r comes*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r his*r Father*r with*r the*r holy*r angels.”*r
